page.title: 09MOOREND DAIRY FARM ASHPERTON
page.content: Moorend Farm covers 148 acres and has been the same size for at least the last 30 years. The land is gently sloping and is mainly sown grass, the soil being good and fertile although heavy. Altogether the farm has about Â£20,000 invested in machinery including four tractors. The farm keeps its own Dairy Shorthorn bull which serves the better cows in the herd. Artificial Insemination is used for breeding from the poorer stock. There are seventy cows in the herd, predominantly Shorthorns (but with three or four Friesians). Twenty five per cent of the calves bred are kept. The farm also has ten ewes which are of a rare breed.
